<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityGroupRuleArgs-policy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/securityGroupRule.ts#L213">property <b>policy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>policy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Authorization policy, can be either `accept` or `drop`, the default value is `accept`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityGroupRuleArgs-portRange">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/securityGroupRule.ts#L218">property <b>portRange</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>portRange?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The range of port numbers relevant to the IP protocol. Default to "-1/-1". When the protocol is tcp or udp, each side port number range from 1 to 65535 and '-1/-1' will be invalid.
For example, `1/200` means that the range of the port numbers is 1-200. Other protocols' 'port_range' can only be "-1/-1", and other values will be invalid.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityGroupRuleArgs-priority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/securityGroupRule.ts#L222">property <b>priority</b></a>

Authorization policy priority, with parameter values: `1-100`, default value: 1.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityGroupRuleArgs-securityGroupId">

The security group to apply this rule to.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityGroupRuleArgs-sourceSecurityGroupId">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SecurityGroupRuleArgs-type">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SnapshotArgs-description">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/snapshot.ts#L141">property <b>description</b></a>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SnapshotArgs-diskId">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SnapshotArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/snapshot.ts#L149">property <b>name</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Name of the snapshot. This name can have a string of 2 to 128 characters, must contain only alphanumeric characters or hyphens, such as "-", ".", "_", and must not begin or end with a hyphen, and must not begin with http:// or https://. Default value is null.

A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>SnapshotPolicyArgs</span></code></pre>

The set of arguments for constructing a SnapshotPolicy resource.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SnapshotPolicyArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/snapshotPolicy.ts#L167">property <b>name</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The snapshot policy name.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SnapshotPolicyArgs-repeatWeekdays">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/snapshotPolicy.ts#L173">property <b>repeatWeekdays</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>repeatWeekdays: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The automatic snapshot repetition dates. The unit of measurement is day and the repeating cycle is a week. Value range: [1, 7], which represents days starting from Monday to Sunday, for example 1  indicates Monday. When you want to schedule multiple automatic snapshot tasks for a disk in a week, you can set the RepeatWeekdays to an array.
- A maximum of seven time points can be selected.
- The format is  an JSON array of ["1", "2", … "7"]  and the time points are separated by commas (,).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SnapshotPolicyArgs-retentionDays">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/snapshotPolicy.ts#L179">property <b>retentionDays</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>retentionDays: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The snapshot retention time, and the unit of measurement is day. Optional values:
- -1: The automatic snapshots are retained permanently.
- [1, 65536]: The number of days retained.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SnapshotPolicyArgs-timePoints">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-alicloud/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/ecs/snapshotPolicy.ts#L185">property <b>timePoints</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>timePoints: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The automatic snapshot creation schedule, and the unit of measurement is hour. Value range: [0, 23], which represents from 00:00 to 24:00,  for example 1 indicates 01:00. When you want to schedule multiple automatic snapshot tasks for a disk in a day, you can set the TimePoints to an array.
- A maximum of 24 time points can be selected.
- The format is  an JSON array of ["0", "1", … "23"] and the time points are separated by commas (,).
